function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Global greenhouse gas emissions have increased more than 40% over the last 25 years, leading to planet-changing forces in motion.","Impact":"Continued emissions increase poses a risk of reaching dangerous points of no return in the Earth's climate system.","Mitigation":"The reduction of global greenhouse gas emissions is essential to prevent catastrophic impacts on the climate system.","Technologies":"Renewable energy technologies, carbon capture and storage, energy efficiency improvements.","People":"Global population, particularly vulnerable communities in low-lying areas and regions prone to extreme weather events.","Owner":"National governments, international organizations, and individuals committed to sustainable practices."},{"Description":"Urgent and significant cuts in global greenhouse gas emissions are required to limit global warming to a relatively safe 1.5-degree increase.","Impact":"Failure to achieve required emissions cuts may lead to catastrophic impacts from climate change.","Mitigation":"Rapid and substantial reductions in greenhouse gas emissions through international cooperation and policy implementation.","Technologies":"Renewable energy infrastructure, carbon pricing mechanisms, sustainable land use practices.","People":"Global population, especially future generations and marginalized communities at higher risk from climate-related disasters.","Owner":"National governments, global climate initiatives, and private sector entities committed to carbon neutrality."},{"Description":"Continued delay in taking serious climate action will lead to the need for even greater emissions cuts and may not prevent catastrophic impacts.","Impact":"Procrastination in addressing climate change increases the risk of irreversible and devastating consequences for the planet.","Mitigation":"Immediate and sustained efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, transition to low-carbon economies, and invest in climate-resilient infrastructure.","Technologies":"Renewable energy deployment, carbon removal technologies, climate adaptation strategies.","People":"Global population, ecosystems, and biodiversity at risk of irreversible damage from climate change.","Owner":"International community, public and private sector collaboration, and individuals advocating for sustainable development."}]}
